words.definition: The chest is the front part of a person’s body under the neck.
words.example: The water in the lake was as high as my chest.

words.definition: If you have confidence about something, you are sure of it.
words.example: I have confidence that I did well on the test.

words.definition: A consequence is a result of a choice or action.
words.example: As a consequence of missing my bus, I had to find another way to work.

words.definition: A disaster is a really bad thing that happens.
words.example: When the car crashed, it was a disaster.

words.definition: To disturb someone means to upset them or interrupt what they are doing.
words.example: Please do not disturb me while I am working.

words.definition: To estimate something is to make a guess about it.
words.example: The boy estimated that he would be home in thirty minutes.

words.definition: To honor is to show respect for something or someone.
words.example: Each year we honor those who died in the war.

words.definition: To impress someone is to make them think that you are good.
words.example: He was able to impress the girls with his new car.

words.definition: A marathon is a very long foot race.
words.example: I ran a marathon and now my legs hurt.

words.definition: When something is narrow, it is very thin.
words.example: The girl walked through the narrow path.

words.definition: When something is pale, it is very light in color.
words.example: The girl’s skin was very pale.

words.definition: When something is rough, it is not smooth.
words.example: The surface of the table was rough.

words.definition: To satisfy someone is to make them happy.
words.example: It will satisfy my hunger if I eat this sandwich.

words.definition: To scream is to make a loud noise with your mouth.
words.example: The girl screamed when she saw the spider.

words.definition: When someone is sensitive, they are easily hurt.
words.example: My teeth are very sensitive to cold water.

words.definition: Shade is a dark area where there is no sun.
words.example: The tree provided shade from the sun.

words.definition: To supplement something is to add something else to it.
words.example: I supplement my diet with vitamins.

words.definition: Terror is a feeling of very great fear.
words.example: I felt a sense of terror when I saw the tiger.

words.definition: A threat is a promise to do something bad to someone.
words.example: The man made a threat against his neighbor.

words.definition: A victim is a person who is hurt or killed by something or someone.
words.example: I was a victim of a crime.
